name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.mk.inj
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
X‚úù : C
p‚úù : Quiver.Hom X‚úù X‚úù
idem‚úù : autoParam (Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp p‚úù p‚úù) p‚úù) _auto‚úù
X : C
p : Quiver.Hom X X
idem : autoParam (Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp p p) p) _auto‚úù
x‚úù : Eq { X := X‚úù, p := p‚úù, idem := idem‚úù } { X := X, p := p, idem := idem }
‚ä¢ And (Eq X‚úù X) (HEq p‚úù p)
decl:
/-- In a preadditive category `C`, when an object `X` decomposes as `X ‚âÖ P ‚®ø Q`, one may
consider `P` as a direct factor of `X` and up to unique isomorphism, it is determined by the
obvious idempotent `X ‚ü∂ P ‚ü∂ X` which is the projection onto `P` with kernel `Q`. More generally,
one may define a formal direct factor of an object `X : C` : it consists of an idempotent
`p : X ‚ü∂ X` which is thought as the "formal image" of `p`. The type `Karoubi C` shall be the
type of the objects of the karoubi envelope of `C`. It makes sense for any category `C`. -/
structure Karoubi where
  /-- an object of the underlying category -/
  X : C
  /-- an endomorphism of the object -/
  p : X ‚ü∂ X
  /-- the condition that the given endomorphism is an idempotent -/
  idem : p ‚â´ p = p := by aesop_cat

  /-- an object of the underlying category -/

  idem : p ‚â´ p = p := by aesop_cat

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.ext
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
P Q : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
h_X : Eq P.X Q.X
h_p : Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp P.p (CategoryTheory.eqToHom h_X)) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.eqToHom h_X) Q.p)
‚ä¢ Eq P Q
decl:
@[ext (iff := false)]
theorem ext {P Q : Karoubi C} (h_X : P.X = Q.X) (h_p : P.p ‚â´ eqToHom h_X = eqToHom h_X ‚â´ Q.p) :
    P = Q := by
  cases P
  cases Q
  dsimp at h_X h_p
  subst h_X
  simpa only [mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, eqToHom_refl, comp_id, id_comp] using h_p

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.Hom.ext_iff
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
P Q : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
x y : P.Hom Q
‚ä¢ Iff (Eq x y) (Eq x.f y.f)
decl:
/-- A morphism `P ‚ü∂ Q` in the category `Karoubi C` is a morphism in the underlying category
`C` which satisfies a relation, which in the preadditive case, expresses that it induces a
map between the corresponding "formal direct factors" and that it vanishes on the complement
formal direct factor. -/
@[ext]
structure Hom (P Q : Karoubi C) where
  /-- a morphism between the underlying objects -/
  f : P.X ‚ü∂ Q.X
  /-- compatibility of the given morphism with the given idempotents -/
  comm : f = P.p ‚â´ f ‚â´ Q.p := by aesop_cat

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.p_comp
initialProofState:

inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C

‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp P.p f.f) f.f
decl:
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
theorem p_comp {P Q : Karoubi C} (f : Hom P Q) : P.p ‚â´ f.f = f.f := by rw [f.comm, ‚Üê assoc, P.idem]

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.comp_proof
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
P Q R : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
g : Q.Hom R
f : P.Hom Q
‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp f.f g.f) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp P.p (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp f.f g.f) R.p))
decl:
theorem comp_proof {P Q R : Karoubi C} (g : Hom Q R) (f : Hom P Q) :
    f.f ‚â´ g.f = P.p ‚â´ (f.f ‚â´ g.f) ‚â´ R.p := by rw [assoc, comp_p, ‚Üê assoc, p_comp]

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.hom_ext_iff
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
P Q : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
f g : Quiver.Hom P Q
‚ä¢ Iff (Eq f g) (Eq f.f g.f)
decl:
@[simp]
theorem hom_ext_iff {P Q : Karoubi C} {f g : P ‚ü∂ Q} : f = g ‚Üî f.f = g.f := by
  constructor
  ¬∑ intro h
    rw [h]
  ¬∑ apply Hom.ext

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.hom_ext
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
P Q : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
f g : Quiver.Hom P Q
h : Eq f.f g.f
‚ä¢ Eq f g
decl:
@[ext]
theorem hom_ext {P Q : Karoubi C} (f g : P ‚ü∂ Q) (h : f.f = g.f) : f = g := by
  simpa [hom_ext_iff] using h

theorem comp_f {P Q R : Karoubi C} (f : P ‚ü∂ Q) (g : Q ‚ü∂ R) : (f ‚â´ g).f = f.f ‚â´ g.f := rfl

theorem id_f {P : Karoubi C} : Hom.f (ùüô P) = P.p := rfl

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.eqToHom_f
initialProofState:

‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.eqToHom h).f (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp P.p (CategoryTheory.eqToHom ‚ãØ))
decl:
@[simp]
theorem eqToHom_f {P Q : Karoubi C} (h : P = Q) :
    Karoubi.Hom.f (eqToHom h) = P.p ‚â´ eqToHom (congr_arg Karoubi.X h) := by
  subst h
  simp only [eqToHom_refl, Karoubi.id_f, comp_id]

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.toKaroubi_obj_p
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
X : C
‚ä¢ Eq ((CategoryTheory.Idempotents.toKaroubi C).obj X).p (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.id X)
decl:
/-- The obvious fully faithful functor `toKaroubi` sends an object `X : C` to the obvious
formal direct factor of `X` given by `ùüô X`. -/
@[simps]
def toKaroubi : C ‚•§ Karoubi C where
  obj X := ‚ü®X, ùüô X, by rw [comp_id]‚ü©
  map f := ‚ü®f, by simp only [comp_id, id_comp]‚ü©

instance : (toKaroubi C).Faithful where
  map_injective := fun h => congr_arg Karoubi.Hom.f h

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.instAdd_add
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Preadditive C
P Q : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
f g : Quiver.Hom P Q
‚ä¢ Eq (HAdd.hAdd f g) { f := HAdd.hAdd f.f g.f, comm := ‚ãØ }
decl:
@[simps add]
instance instAdd [Preadditive C] {P Q : Karoubi C} : Add (P ‚ü∂ Q) where
  add f g := ‚ü®f.f + g.f, by rw [add_comp, comp_add, ‚Üê f.comm, ‚Üê g.comm]‚ü©

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.instNeg_neg

instance instNeg [Preadditive C] {P Q : Karoubi C} : Neg (P ‚ü∂ Q) where

-- dsimp loops when applying this lemma to its LHS,

initialProofState:

  hom_ext_iff

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.inclusionHom_apply
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Preadditive C
P Q : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
f : Quiver.Hom P Q
‚ä¢ Eq ((P.inclusionHom Q) f) f.f
decl:
/-- The map sending `f : P ‚ü∂ Q` to `f.f : P.X ‚ü∂ Q.X` is additive. -/
@[simps]
def inclusionHom [Preadditive C] (P Q : Karoubi C) : AddMonoidHom (P ‚ü∂ Q) (P.X ‚ü∂ Q.X) where
  toFun f := f.f
  map_zero' := rfl
  map_add' _ _ := rfl

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.sum_hom

C : Type u_1

P Q : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
Œ± : Type u_2
s : Finset Œ±
f : Œ± ‚Üí Quiver.Hom P Q
‚ä¢ Eq (s.sum fun x => f x).f (s.sum fun x => (f x).f)
decl:
@[simp]
theorem sum_hom [Preadditive C] {P Q : Karoubi C} {Œ± : Type*} (s : Finset Œ±) (f : Œ± ‚Üí (P ‚ü∂ Q)) :
    (‚àë x ‚àà s, f x).f = ‚àë x ‚àà s, (f x).f :=
  map_sum (inclusionHom P Q) f s

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.instIsIdempotentCompleteKaroubi
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
‚ä¢ CategoryTheory.IsIdempotentComplete (CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C)
decl:
instance : IsIdempotentComplete (Karoubi C) := by
  refine ‚ü®?_‚ü©
  intro P p hp
  simp only [hom_ext_iff, comp_f] at hp
  use ‚ü®P.X, p.f, hp‚ü©
  use ‚ü®p.f, by rw [comp_p p, hp]‚ü©
  use ‚ü®p.f, by rw [hp, p_comp p]‚ü©
  simp [hp]

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.instEssSurjKaroubiToKaroubiOfIsIdempotentComplete
initialProofState:

inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.IsIdempotentComplete C
‚ä¢ (CategoryTheory.Idempotents.toKaroubi C).EssSurj
decl:
instance [IsIdempotentComplete C] : (toKaroubi C).EssSurj :=
  ‚ü®fun P => by
    rcases IsIdempotentComplete.idempotents_split P.X P.p P.idem with ‚ü®Y, i, e, ‚ü®h‚ÇÅ, h‚ÇÇ‚ü©‚ü©
    use Y
    exact
      Nonempty.intro
        { hom := ‚ü®i, by erw [id_comp, ‚Üê h‚ÇÇ, ‚Üê assoc, h‚ÇÅ, id_comp]‚ü©
          inv := ‚ü®e, by erw [comp_id, ‚Üê h‚ÇÇ, assoc, h‚ÇÅ, comp_id]‚ü© }‚ü©

/-- If `C` is idempotent complete, the functor `toKaroubi : C ‚•§ Karoubi C` is an equivalence. -/
instance toKaroubi_isEquivalence [IsIdempotentComplete C] : (toKaroubi C).IsEquivalence where

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.decompId_i_f

decl:
/-- The split mono which appears in the factorisation `decompId P`. -/
@[simps]
def decompId_i (P : Karoubi C) : P ‚ü∂ P.X :=
  ‚ü®P.p, by rw [coe_p, comp_id, P.idem]‚ü©

@[simps]
def decompId_p (P : Karoubi C) : (P.X : Karoubi C) ‚ü∂ P :=
  ‚ü®P.p, by rw [coe_p, id_comp, P.idem]‚ü©

name: CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi.decompId
initialProofState:
C : Type u_1
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Category.{u_2, u_1} C
P : CategoryTheory.Idempotents.Karoubi C
‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.id P) (CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp P.decompId_i P.decompId_p)
decl:
/-- The formal direct factor of `P.X` given by the idempotent `P.p` in the category `C`
is actually a direct factor in the category `Karoubi C`. -/
@[reassoc]
theorem decompId (P : Karoubi C) : ùüô P = decompId_i P ‚â´ decompId_p P := by
  ext
  simp only [comp_f, id_f, P.idem, decompId_i, decompId_p]

theorem decompId (P : Karoubi C) : ùüô P = decompId_i P ‚â´ decompId_p P := by

theorem zsmul_hom [Preadditive C] {P Q : Karoubi C} (n : ‚Ñ§) (f : P ‚ü∂ Q) : (n ‚Ä¢ f).f = n ‚Ä¢ f.f :=
  map_zsmul (inclusionHom P Q) n f
